title: 115_hr2767
content: The Act titled "Stimulating Innovation through Procurement Act of 2017" amends the Small Business Act to define a senior procurement executive and include them in SBIR and STTR programs. The "Stimulating Innovation through Procurement Act of 2017" includes senior procurement executives in SBIR and STTR programs to assist small businesses in commercializing research before being awarded a contract from the relevant Federal agency. The "Stimulating Innovation through Procurement Act of 2017" involves modifications related to procurement center representatives and other acquisition personnel. The SBIR Amendment requires procurement center representatives to assist small businesses in the SBIR program with researching solicitations and submitting bids for Federal contracts. The SBIR Amendment requires procurement center representatives to assist small businesses in the STTR program with researching applicable solicitations for Federal contracts. The SBIR Amendment mandates procurement center representatives to aid small businesses in the STTR program by assisting in researching relevant solicitations for Federal contracts and providing technical support for bid submissions. They are also required to collaborate with senior procurement executives and the Director of the Office of Small and Disadvantaged Business Utilization to offer necessary assistance. The SBIR Amendment requires procurement center representatives to support small businesses in the STTR program by helping with research on Federal contract solicitations and providing technical assistance for bid submissions. They must also work with senior procurement executives and the Director of the Office of Small and Disadvantaged Business Utilization to provide necessary aid. Section 15(l)(2) of the Small Business Act is amended to assist small businesses in SBIR or STTR programs with researching Federal contract solicitations and providing technical assistance for bid submissions. The Small Business Act is amended to assist small businesses in SBIR or STTR programs with researching Federal contract solicitations and providing technical assistance for bid submissions, including coordination with senior procurement executives and the Office of Small and Disadvantaged Business Utilization. SEC. 6. Amendment to the duties of the Director of Small and Disadvantaged Business Utilization for Federal agencies. Section 15(k) of the Small Business Act is amended to provide assistance to small businesses in SBIR or STTR programs with researching solicitations and submitting bids for Federal contracts. To bid for a Federal contract, small businesses in SBIR or STTR programs can receive assistance with researching solicitations and coordinating with procurement representatives and senior procurement executives.
